com.pi4j.component.potentiometer

Interface Potentiometer

  • All Superinterfaces:
    Component
    All Known Subinterfaces:
    MicrochipPotentiometer
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    MCP4431, MCP4432, MCP4441, MCP4442, MCP4451, MCP4452, MCP4461, MCP4462, MCP4531, MCP4532, MCP4541, MCP4542, MCP4551, MCP4552, MCP4561, MCP4562, MCP4631, MCP4632, MCP4641, MCP4642, MCP4651, MCP4652, MCP4661, MCP4662, MicrochipPotentiometerBase

    public interface Potentiometer
extends Component
    A digital potentiometer component

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void decrease()
      Decrease the wiper's value by one step.
      void decrease(int steps)
      Decrease the wiper's value by n steps.
      int getCurrentValue()
      The implementation should cache to wiper's value and therefore should avoid accessing the device to often.
      int getMaxValue() 
      void increase()
      Increase the wiper's value by one step.

      Increase the wiper's value by n steps.

      • Methods inherited from interface com.pi4j.component.Component

        clearProperties, getName, getProperties, getProperty, getProperty, getTag, hasProperty, removeProperty, setName, setProperty, setTag

    • Method Detail

      • getMaxValue

        int getMaxValue()
        Returns:
        The maximum wiper-value supported by the device

      • isRheostat

        boolean isRheostat()
        Returns:
        Whether the device is a potentiometer or a rheostat

      • setCurrentValue

        void setCurrentValue(int value)
              throws IOException
        Set wiper's value. Values from 0 to 'maxValue' are valid. Values above or below this boundaries are corrected quietly.
        Parameters:
        value - The wiper's value.
        Throws:
        IOException - If communication with the device fails
        See Also:
        getMaxValue()

      • getCurrentValue

        int getCurrentValue()
             throws IOException
        The implementation should cache to wiper's value and therefore should avoid accessing the device to often.
        Returns:
        The wiper's current value.
        Throws:
        IOException - If communication with the device fails

      • increase

        void increase()
       throws IOException
        Increase the wiper's value by one step. It is not an error if the wiper already hit the upper boundary. In this situation the wiper doesn't change.
        Throws:
        IOException - If communication with the device fails
        See Also:
        getMaxValue()

      • increase

        void increase(int steps)
       throws IOException
        Increase the wiper's value by n steps. It is not an error if the wiper hits or already hit the upper boundary. In such situations the wiper sticks to the upper boundary or doesn't change.
        Parameters:
        steps - How many steps to increase.
        Throws:
        IOException - If communication with the device fails

      • decrease

        void decrease()
       throws IOException
        Decrease the wiper's value by one step. It is not an error if the wiper already hit the lower boundary (0). In this situation the wiper doesn't change.
        Throws:
        IOException - If communication with the device fails

      • decrease

        void decrease(int steps)
       throws IOException
        Decrease the wiper's value by n steps. It is not an error if the wiper hits or already hit the lower boundary (0). In such situations the wiper sticks to the lower boundary or doesn't change.
        Parameters:
        steps - How many steps to decrease.
        Throws:
        IOException - If communication with the device fails
